question: Can I qualify for a mortgage with an annual income of $75,000 and a debt of $10,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an annual income of $75,000 and DTI of 13.33%, you qualify. Ensure a down payment of 3-20%.

steps.content: Can I qualify for a mortgage with an annual income of $75,000 and a debt of $10,000?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for mortgage qualification criteria. 2) Calculate DTI ratio. 3) Involve credit_agent if needed. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage qualification criteria.
Qualifying typically requires a DTI ratio below 43% and stable income.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio based on provided figures.
DTI calculated as 13.33%, well below 43% threshold.
Does my credit score matter in this situation?
Credit score typically affects the interest rate rather than qualification if above minimum required.
What should I know about the down payment?
Retrieving knowledge on standard down payment requirements.
Down payments typically range from 3% to 20% depending on the loan type.
Review complete, all calculations and criteria check out.
Yes, with an annual income of $75,000 and DTI of 13.33%, you qualify. Ensure a down payment of 3-20%.
